equations

Class Equation

  • java.lang.Object
    • equations.Equation

  • public class Equation
extends java.lang.Object

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Equation()
      Creates a new, empty equation.
      Equation(java.util.List<OrbitRepresentative> lhsGraphlets, java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> lhsCounts, OrbitRepresentative rhsGraphlet, java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> connected)
      Creates a new equation with specified orbits and factors in the left-hand side and a specific orbit and one set of common nodes in the right-hand side.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Equation

        public Equation()
        Creates a new, empty equation. All factors left-hand and right-hand side are 0, all graphlets are null;

      • Equation

        public Equation(java.util.List<OrbitRepresentative> lhsGraphlets,
        java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> lhsCounts,
        OrbitRepresentative rhsGraphlet,
        java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> connected)
        Creates a new equation with specified orbits and factors in the left-hand side and a specific orbit and one set of common nodes in the right-hand side.
        Parameters:
        lhsGraphlets - List of OrbitGraphlets in the left-hand side of the equation. The order of these orbits must correspond to the order of their factors in the next parameter!
        lhsCounts - List of factors corresponding to the orbits. The order of these factors must correspond to the order of the orbits in the previous parameter!
        rhsGraphlet - The OrbitGraphlet over which the sum of common factors is calculated.
        connected - One List of Integers, representing the nodes from the previous OrbitGraphlet of which the common neighbours must be calculated.

    • Method Detail

      • isCompatible

        public boolean isCompatible(Equation e)
        Checks whether two equations are able to be merged, i.e. whether all orbits in the left-hand side and the orbit in the right-hand side of one graphlet are equal to those of the other.
        Parameters:
        e - The Equation to be checked for compatibility against this equation.
        Returns:
        True if the equations can be merged, false if they cannot.

      • merge

        public void merge(Equation e)
        Merges two equations. To do so, both equations' orbits must be equal. The terms describing the common nodes in the right-hand side are added. If the graphlets on the left-hand side are exactly equal, their factors are summed.
        Parameters:
        e - The equation to be merged into this one.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object

      • minus

        public static int minus(java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> connect,
        OrbitRepresentative g)
        Calculates the negative term that appears in an equation with given common nodes and right-hand side orbit representative. This term is equal to the number of nodes within the orbit representative that are common neighbors to the given nodes.
        Parameters:
        connect - The nodes of which the common neighbors are taken.
        g - The OrbitGraphlet in the right-hand side.
        Returns:
        The term that has to be subtracted from the number of common nodes in equations with the given terms in the right-hand side

      • rhsFormula

        public static java.lang.String rhsFormula(java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> connect,
                          OrbitRepresentative g)
        Returns the string version of a common neighbor term of the equation.
        Parameters:
        connect - The nodes of which a common neighbor is sought
        g - The OrbitGraphlet in which those nodes are situated.
        Returns:
        A readable string version of the common neighbor term.

      • getLhs

        public java.util.Map<OrbitRepresentative,java.lang.Integer> getLhs()
        Returns the left-hand side of the equation in map form.
        Returns:
        A Map containing the left-hand side of the equation: the keys are the orbits, their values are their factors.

      • getRhsOrbit

        public OrbitRepresentative getRhsOrbit()
        Returns the orbit in the right-hand side of the equation.
        Returns:
        The orbit in the right-hand side of the equation.

      • getMinus

        public int getMinus()
        Returns the total negative term in the right-hand side.
        Returns:
        The total negative term in the right-hand side.

      • getLowestOrbit

        public int getLowestOrbit()
        Returns the number of the lowest orbit in this equation's left-hand side.
        Returns:
        The number of the lowest orbit in this equation's left-hand side.
